LightningComponentBundle.description: Enhanced datatable with the ability to add and remove records

propertyType.name: T
propertyType.label: Datatable Object API Name
propertyType.description: Select the API Name of the SObject to use in the Datatable

property.name: tableData
property.label: Data Source Record Collection
property.description: Record Collection variable containing the records to display in the datatable.

property.name: columns
property.label: Columns
property.description: JSON string with the columns to display in the datatable.

property.name: noRecordsMessage
property.label: No Records Message
property.description: Message to display instead of the datatable if there are no records.

property.name: canAdd
property.label: Can Add?
property.description: This will add the record to the outputAddedRows and you will need to write these back to the Object with a Record Insert in the Flow.

property.name: addLabel
property.label: Add Button Label
property.description: Label to show in the Add button, if empty, it will only show the icon.

property.name: addType
property.label: Add Type
property.description: Specify wether you want to be able to add the data directly in the table (Inline) or with a Flow.

property.name: addFlowName
property.label: Flow Name
property.description: Screen flow name to fire whenever the add button is clicked. A 'recordOutput' SObject record Output variable is needed

property.name: addFlowInputVariables
property.label: Flow Input Variables
property.description: JSON string with the input variables to send to the flow.

property.name: canEdit
property.label: Can Edit?
property.description: This will add the record to the outputEditedRows and you will need to write these back to the Object with a Record Update in the Flow.

property.name: editType
property.label: Edit Type
property.description: Specify wether you want to be able to edit the data directly in the table (Inline) or with a Flow. If Edit is with a flow, then Add must be with a Flow

property.name: editLabel
property.label: Edit Button Label
property.description: Label to show in the Edit button when Editing with a flow.

property.name: editFlowName
property.label: Flow Name
property.description: Screen flow name to fire whenever the edit button in the row is clicked. A 'recordId' Input Variable and a 'recordOutput' SObject record Output variable are needed

property.name: editFlowInputVariables
property.label: Flow Input Variables
property.description: JSON string with the input variables to send to the flow.

property.name: canDelete
property.label: Can Delete?
property.description: This will add the record to the outputDeletedRows and you will need to write these back to the Object with a Record Delete in the Flow.

property.name: canBulkDelete
property.label: Can Bulk Delete?
property.description: Add a selection and a button to delete several lines at one time. This will add the record to the outputDeletedRows and you will need to write these back to the Object with a Record Delete in the Flow.

property.name: bulkDeleteLabel
property.label: Bulk Delete Label
property.description: Label to show in the Bulk Delete button, if empty, it will only show the icon.

property.name: canBulkEdit
property.label: Can Bulk Edit?
property.description: Add a selection and a button to edit several lines at one time. This will add the record to the outputEditedRows and you will need to write these back to the Object with a Record Update in the Flow.

property.name: bulkEditLabel
property.label: Bulk Edit Label
property.description: Label to show in the Bulk Edit button, if empty, it will only show the icon.

property.name: isMasterDetail
property.label: Is Master-Detail?
property.description: Is this the detail object on a Master-Detail relationship?. If so, you will need to specify the fields and the values for the parent/s.

property.name: inlineSave
property.label: Save Enabled?
property.description: If enabled, a Save button will appear in the table to be able to save the changes. If disabled the outputs will be send back to the flow and the user will need to do the saving.

property.name: saveLabel
property.label: Save Label
property.description: Label to show in the Save button if inline save is enabled.

property.name: navigateNextAfterSave
property.label: Navigate Next after Save?
property.description: If enabled, after clicking Save it will execute the Next button navigation of the screen and it will output the variable 'saveAndNext' = true.

property.name: listenToPlatformEvent
property.label: Listen to Platform Event?
property.description: If enabled, the component will listened to the OD_Refresh_Datatable__e Platform Event and refreshes itself when there is matching Id

property.name: platformEventMatchingFieldName
property.label: Refresh Matching Field
property.description: The fieldName to use when matching and refreshing with Platform event

property.name: platformEventMatchingId
property.label: Refresh Matching Id
property.description: Variable, Constant, formula etc, that contains the matching id to use when refreshing with Platform event

property.name: pagination
property.label: Pagination Enabled?
property.description: If enabled, the data will be paginated and a control for the pagination will be displayed

property.name: pageSize
property.label: Page Size
property.description: Number of records to display per page

property.name: paginationAlignment
property.label: Pagination Alignment
property.description: Alignment for the pagination controls

property.name: paginationShowOptions
property.label: Display Navigation Options?
property.description: If enabled, the pagination options: First, Prev, Next and Last will be showed, otherwise just the page numbers

property.name: grouping
property.label: Grouping Enabled?
property.description: If enabled, the data will be grouped by the field specified

property.name: groupingField
property.label: Group By
property.description: Field to group the data by. If the field is not present in the dataset then it will not group the data

property.name: groupSortField
property.label: Sort Group By
property.description: Field to sort the group the data by. It can be the Grouping field or any of the summarized columns (if any). Default is the Grouping Field

property.name: groupSortDirection
property.label: Group Sort Direction
property.description: Order the groups ASC (A-Z, 0-9, Oldest dates first) or DESC (Z-A, 9-0, Newest Dates first). Default is ASC

property.name: groupContentSortField
property.label: Sort Content of Group By
property.description: Field to sort the content of the group by. It can be one of the fields being showed in the table.

property.name: groupContentSortDirection
property.label: Group Content Sort Direction
property.description: Order the content of the group ASC (A-Z, 0-9, Oldest dates first) or DESC (Z-A, 9-0, Newest Dates first). Default is ASC

property.name: groupingSource
property.label: Source
property.description: Specify wether you want the grouping to be based on data from the source data or grouping by the picklist options. If picklist, then you can select to show/hide the empty groups. If dataset, then it will only show the ones with data and the records without it as a last group.

property.name: groupingSourceFieldData
property.label: Source Field Data
property.description: If the grouping source is the Picklist field data, this is a comma separated string of all the values to group by for

property.name: showEmptyGroups
property.label: Show Empty?
property.description: If enabled, the groups with no data in it will be shown.

property.name: showTotalsByGroup
property.label: Show Totals By Group?
property.description: If enabled, a line with the totals by group will be shown.

property.name: recalculateLive
property.label: Recalculate totals on the fly?
property.description: If enabled and Add or Edit is inline, the totals will be recalculated whenever the data changes in the table

property.name: masterDetailConfiguration
property.label: Master-Detail Configuration
property.description: JSON string with the columns and values for the master detail relationships

property.name: saveAndNext
property.label: Was it a Save and Next action?
property.description: True if the 'navigateNextAfterSave' was enabled.

property.name: outputAddedRows
property.label: Output Added Rows
property.description: Record Collection variable with all the added records in the datatable.

property.name: outputEditedRows
property.label: Output Edited Rows
property.description: Record Collection variable with all the edited records in the datatable.

property.name: outputDeletedRows
property.label: Output Deleted Rows
property.description: Record Collection variable with all the deleted records in the datatable.

property.name: rowRecordId
property.label: The record Id of the row
property.description: The record Id of the row after clicking one of the custom buttons and coming back from the flow. Only used if Navigate Next after flow is selected.

property.name: rowRecordIds
property.label: The record Ids of the selected rows
property.description: The record Ids of the selected rows after clicking one of the custom buttons and coming back from the flow. Only used if Navigate Next after flow is selected.

property.name: rowButtonClicked
property.label: The Button label clicked
property.description: The label of the button that was clicked to open the flow. Only used if Navigate Next after flow is selected or the button is Navigate Next

property.name: wasChanged
property.label: Was the data change is some shape or form?
property.description: True if the data was changed (added/edited/deleted).
